thread.title: Healthcare Services Q2 Earnings Miss, Hikes Dividend - Analyst Blog
thread.title_full: Healthcare Services Q2 Earnings Miss, Hikes Dividend - Analyst Blog

title: Healthcare Services Q2 Earnings Miss, Hikes Dividend - Analyst Blog
text:
Content preferences Done 
Healthcare Services Group, Inc . HCSG reported second-quarter 2015 net income of 23 cents per share, which missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate by a penny. The reported earnings, however, were 15% higher than 20 cents earned a year ago. The bottom-line growth was driven by an increase in revenues. Healthcare Services Group Inc. - Earnings Surprise | FindTheBest 
Behind the Headlines Healthcare Servicesâ€™ revenues for the quarter improved 11.3% year over year to $355.4 million. However, the top line missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $360 million.Cost of services provided increased 10.3% to $304.2 million during the reported quarter. Selling, general and administrative expenses also rose nearly 13%. Both on a year-over-year basis.Investment and interest income dropped 69.9% year over year to $0.24 million in the quarter. Financial Update Healthcare Services Group exited the reported quarter with cash and cash equivalents of $85.9 million, up 14.1% from $75.3 million at year-end 2014.Total assets came in at $486.7 million as on Jun 30, 2015, up 3.7% from $469.6 million at the end of 2014.Stockholders' equity was $290.9 million as of Jun 30, 2015, up 3.5% from $275.8 million on Dec 31, 2014. Dividend Update The board of directors of Healthcare Services hiked the quarterly cash dividend by nearly 6% to 17.88 cents per share. The increased dividend is payable on Sep 25, to shareholders on record as of Aug 21, 2015. This marks the 48th straight hike by the company. Moreover, this is the 49th consecutive quarterly cash dividend since the company initiated the payout in 2003. Zacks Rank and Stocks to Consider Currently, Healthcare Services has a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell). Better-ranked players from the business service sector include Rentrak Corporation RENT, comScore, Inc. SCOR and PFSweb Inc. PFSW. While Rentrak sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), both comScore and PFSweb hold a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
